About Me.name: Daniel Chen
About Me.summary: Experienced Cloud Support Engineer with over six years in diverse technical roles, specializing in application development, customer support, and user experience improvement within agile environments

Experience.name: IBM in Durham, NC
Experience.summary: At IBM, I boosted cloud service efficiency, becoming a top case closer in North America while delivering exceptional customer satisfaction. My problem-solving and leadership drove projects beyond their goals, demonstrating my dedication to success.

Experience.name: LINKMedicine in Balimore, MD
Experience.summary: At LINKMedicine, I developed WeChat mini program prototypes and webpages, improving user experience and aligning with branding, thereby enhancing digital engagement.

projects.name: Team Wiki, Project Lead
projects.summary: I spearheaded the creation of a comprehensive knowledge base designed to document processes and bolster team self-sufficiency. I gathered critical information, including common service issues, troubleshooting guides, support enablement procedures, and best practices. This information was then organized into individual service pages, ensuring quick access and enhanced usability for the team. In addition, I actively encouraged team participation and integrated a feedback form into the website. This initiative not only facilitated continuous improvement of the wiki but also fostered a collaborative environment where team input was valued and utilized to optimize our collective knowledge base.

projects.name: Service Level Objective Analysis, Project Lead
projects.summary: I undertook a detailed compilation and analysis of data for tickets that failed to meet our first response time objectives, identifying the root causes of these misses and formulating a strategic plan to mitigate them. This involved leading weekly team meetings where we delved into the analyses and collaborated on implementing solutions to enhance our workflow efficiency. Our efforts saw the team's average attainment rate increase from 80% to over 95% within just a year of initiating this project, showcasing our ability to significantly improve performance through focused teamwork and strategic planning.

awards.title: SAPA Hopkins
awards.summary: Received first place in biohealth innovation for the conceptualization of our application, which was designed to help users make rational decisions about healthcare by employing complex analyses of big medical data. Our concept beat more than 15 other teams, winning 34.7% of the total votes in an annual forum with more than 1000 participants, including multinational pharmaceutical companies, investment firms, and research institutions.'
